data.title: Great Train Robbery by Michael Crichton, First Edition
data.meta_description: The Great Train Robbery by Michael Crichton and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. Signed by previous owner. The dust jacket is a little shelf rubbed and edge worn. There are minor marks around the block of the book. Now protected in cellophane. The binding is excellent. GK. Our orders are shipped using tracked courier delivery services.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. This is a Very Good Copy of this hardcover book in a Very Good Dust-Jacket with small repaired closed tear to the head of spine and one closed tear to base of spine,and with light rubbing to extremities of the dust-jacket.Price clipped and this copy has one previous inscription present to the front endpaper.The dust-jacket comes well protected in a removable cover sleeve.8vo 266pp First Edition 1st Impression [1975].

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. The Great Train Robbery by Michael Crichton, Hardcover, First English Edition (1975). Book in very good condition, in a similar unclipped dust jacket. There is some spotting and foxing to the inside front and back cover of the book. Nonetheless a very good copy for the year. (See pictures).

Hardcover. Condition: Good +. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition/First Printing. An ex-library copy with some of the usual defects normally associated to an ex-library. The 7.95 priced jacket has some glue residue to reverse of both flaps with some bleed thorugh, short crease to rear flap. Actually not too bad for an ex-library jacket. THIS COPY IS IN MY POSSESSION AND NORMALLY SHIPS NEXT DAY. Book.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. First UK edition, Fine minus book with slightest of bumps bottom corners, in a Very Good to Near Fine jacket that has a white chip to jacket color near top corner of front panel, light edge wear, couple of slight overwrite impressions back panel, touch of rubbing. Crichton's third novel involves a gold theft during the 1880s.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. First edition, stated. A good copy with some fading and spotting in a very good DJ protected in removable mylar cover. See my photos of the book you will receive, not stock photos. More available upon request. This book is in my possession and will be packed in bubble wrap and shipped in a cardboard box. USPS tracking provided. #37.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. First edition, first impression. Octavo. Bound in olive coloured paper covered hard boards over brown cloth covered spine; in the original price clipped dust jacket. An early Crichton novel about a Victorian era train robbery in England which was adapted by the author himself for the screen in 1978, in a film starring Sean Connery and Donald Sutherland. Book and jacket are both in Near Fine condition, previous owner's name to the front endpaper.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good+. First Edition Thus; First Printing. We consider each and every book we sell to be a treasure. That's why we provide accurate individualized condition descriptions; ship in sturdy protective packaging; and offer excellent customer service.; Half yellow cloth cover with green boards is buckled at spine with turned in spine caps and light soiling but overall in very good- condition. Boards and spine are straight. Binding is tight. Pages are toned otherwise clean and pristine. Dust jacket has light wear with creasing on back panel but clean and bright with soiling on underside of DJ. DJ protected by a brand new, clear, acid-free mylar cover. We add mylar covers to all books with DJs to preserve the DJs and add luster to magnify their beauty. (If pictured, shown without the mylar cover for an accurate representation of dust jacket. ); 9.4 X 6.5 X 2.3 inches; 688 pages.

[Locomotive thievery] FIRST UK EDITION. Octavo (23 x 15cm), pp.255 [1]. Publisher's mid brown cloth with gilt titles to spine. With the pictorial dust-jacket designed by Leigh Taylor, not priced. A crisp, clean copy, showing just a hint of sunning to jacket spine and a touch of light wear to extremities. Near fine. Crichton's best-selling novel based on the Great Gold Robbery of 1855, notably filmed in 1979 starring Sean Connery, Donald Sutherland, and Lesly-Anne Down.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. First Edition/First Printing. A square solid tight very carefully read copy. This copy has some browning/light soil to the edges of the text block. THIS COPY IS IN MY POSSESSION AND NORMALLY SHIPS NEXT DAY. Book.
